contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2012}} '''''In the Red''''' is a 1989 novel by [[Mark Tavener]], a [[black comedy]] revolving around murder, finance, and intrigue in the halls of the [[BBC]]. Despite this, it was the BBC that successfully adapted it for both radio and television. The title comes from the expression "[[wikt:in the red|in the red]]". In 1995, it was adapted for radio by Tavener and [[Peter Baynham]], and aired on [[BBC Radio 4]] with [[Michael Williams (actor)|Michael Williams]] and [[Barry Foster (actor)|Barry Foster]] in lead roles. The radio version was successful, and was followed by three sequels: ''[[In the Balance]]'', ''In the Chair'', and ''In the End''. In 1998, it was adapted for television by [[Malcolm Bradbury]], and aired on [[BBC Two]]. The series included a cast of famous UK television performers including [[Rik Mayall]], [[Warren Clarke]], [[Richard Griffiths]], [[Alun Armstrong (actor)|Alun Armstrong]], [[Stephen Fry]], [[John Sessions]] and [[John Bird (actor)|John Bird]]. In 2000, a pair of characters, BBC executives played in both the radio and television versions by Stephen Fry and John Bird, were spun off into their own Radio 4 series, ''[[Absolute Power (comedy)|Absolute Power]]'', written by Tavener. A television version followed, written by other writers. ==External links and references== *Radio series [http://www.angelfire.com/pq/radiohaha/INTHERED.html ''In the Red''] at radiohaha *Television series {{imdb title|id=0158414|title=In the Red}} [[Category:1989 novels]] [[Category:BBC Radio 4 programmes]] [[Category:BBC Television programmes]]
